section.name: Roles Configuration
section.span: The roles define which JCR permissions each role has.
section.p: The roles are stored in the repository as children of the node /hippo:configuration/hippo:roles. The following JCR permissions exist in the repository: "READ", "WRITE" and "REMOVE". The roles are also used for assigning workflows to users and groups.
The roles are referenced by the domains auth roles and can be assigned to workflows.

subsection.name: hipposys:role
subsection.source: <sv:node sv:name="myrole"> <sv:property sv:name="jcr:primaryType" sv:type="Name"> <sv:value>hipposys:role</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="hipposys:roles" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>editor</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="hipposys:privileges" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>hippo:editor</sv:value> <sv:value>jcr:read</sv:value> </sv:property> </sv:node>
subsection.p: he name of the node is used as the role name.
The boolean properties hippo:jcrread, hippo:jcrwrite and hippo:jcrremove can be set to assign the JCR "READ", "WRITE" and "REMOVE" properties to a rol.
